required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: OIF/β-TCP in Patients With Open Tibial Fractures in Need of Bone Grafting
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Evaluator-blinded, Controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety and Clinical Performance of OIF/β-TCP in Patients With Open Tibial Fractures in Need of Bone Grafting

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, randomized, evaluator-blinded, controlled study for subjects with open tibial fractures classified as Gustilo type II, IIIA or IIIB (see Appendix 1) who will receive bone graft implantation for the potential of delayed union or non-union within 3 months of fracture. Subjects will be followed for safety and clinical performance for the main study period of 30 weeks and an extension follow-up period up to 52 weeks after bone graft implantation.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with complete fracture healing as assessed by CT scan at 30 weeks
Percentage of participants with bridging on three of four cortices assessed by X-Ray (RUST) at 30 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events at Week 30
primary_outcome.description: Absence of any serious product-related AEs and lack of secondary intervention after bone grafting

secondary_outcome.description: Patients with complete bone healing, based on independent blinded central radiographic evaluations of the patient CT scans

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from bone graft implantation to CT scan radiographic fracture healing
secondary_outcome.description: The assessment of time from bone graft implantation to first X-ray radiographic fracture healing

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from bone graft implantation to X-ray radiographic fracture healing
secondary_outcome.description: The assessment of time from bone graft implantation to first X-ray radiographic fracture healing.

Patients is able to walk properly (Full weight bearing), no or mild pain (assessed by VAS score of 0-3) at the fracture site with full weight bearing and no fracture site tenderness on manual palpation
Percentage of subjects who were initially seronegative to OIF at baseline and exhibit authentic positive antibodies at Day 10, Week 6, Week 24 or Week 52
